intro: Boussingaultia leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed boussingaultia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
